column2: What is the main goal of data security?
column3: Protect data confidentiality

column2: What does data confidentiality focus on?
column3: Ensuring data is accessible only to authorized users

column2: What does data integrity focus on?
column3: Ensuring data is accurate and not altered improperly

column2: What does data availability focus on?
column3: Ensuring authorized users can access data when needed

column2: Which control protects data if a laptop is stolen?
column3: Full-disk encryption

column2: What is encryption at rest?
column3: Encrypting data stored on disks or databases
column4: Encrypting data on the network only

column2: What is encryption in transit?
column3: Encrypting data as it moves across networks

column2: Why is key management important for encryption?
column3: If keys are lost or stolen

column2: What is data classification?
column3: Labeling data by sensitivity to apply proper controls

column2: Which data classification typically needs strongest access controls?
column3: Highly confidential

column2: What is data masking?
column3: Obscuring parts of data to prevent exposure

column2: Why is backup important for data security?
column3: Allows recovery after loss

column2: What is a backup retention policy?
column3: Defines how long backups are kept

column2: Why should backups also be encrypted?
column3: They contain full copies of sensitive data

column2: What is data minimization?
column3: Collecting and keeping only necessary data
column4: Collecting as much data as possible

column2: Why is data minimization helpful for security and privacy?
column3: Less data means less to protect and lose

column2: What is tokenization in data security?
column3: Replacing sensitive data with non-sensitive tokens

column2: What is a data breach?
column3: Unauthorized access

column2: Why are access controls important for databases?
column3: Limit who can view or modify data

column2: What is a DLP (Data Loss Prevention) solution used for?
column3: Detect and prevent unauthorized transfer of sensitive data

column2: Why is secure disposal of storage media important?
column3: Residual data may be recovered if not properly destroyed

column2: What is "need-to-know" principle?
column3: Users should access only data required for their tasks

column2: Why are audit logs important for data security?
column3: Track who accessed or changed data

column2: What is "data at rest"?
column3: Data stored on disks

column2: What is "data in use"?
column3: Data actively processed in memory

column2: Why should sensitive data not be stored in plain text?
column3: Can be easily read if exposed

column2: What is a data retention policy?
column3: Defines how long to retain different types of data

column2: Why should old backups be disposed of according to policy?
column3: To reduce risk and storage use

column2: What is "least privilege" for data access?
column3: Grant minimum data access needed for role

column2: Why is database activity monitoring useful?
column3: Detect suspicious queries and access patterns

column2: What is "PII"?
column3: Personally Identifiable Information

column2: Which is an example of PII?
column3: National ID number

column2: What is "data anonymization"?
column3: Removing or altering identifiers so individuals cannot be identified

column2: Why is encryption not always sufficient by itself?
column3: Keys can be stolen and systems can be compromised

column2: What is "database encryption" typically protecting against?
column3: Theft of storage media or backups

column2: Why should developers avoid using production data in test environments?
column3: Test environments are usually less secure

column2: What is "data owner" responsible for?
column3: Deciding who can access and how to protect a dataset

column2: What is "data steward" responsible for?
column3: Managing data quality and usage under owner’s guidance

column2: Why is role-based access control important for data security?
column3: Simplifies managing who can access what data

column2: What is "data leakage"?
column3: Unauthorized or accidental release of sensitive data

column2: Why should portable drives be controlled?
column3: They can carry large amounts of sensitive data easily

column2: What is "data discovery"?
column3: Finding where sensitive data resides

column2: Why is regular data discovery important?
column3: Identify unknown stores of sensitive data

column2: What is "encryption key rotation"?
column3: Regularly changing encryption keys

column2: Why should access to encryption keys be tightly controlled?
column3: Keys unlock sensitive data

column2: What is "data sovereignty"?
column3: Data subject to laws of the country where it resides

column2: Why is physical security relevant for data security?
column3: Physical access can lead to data theft or tampering
